title: Romantic Valentine single-purpose interactive page (Yes/No evasive button + photo reveal)

requirements.summary: Build a single-purpose Valentine prompt view with the exact question text and exactly two visible options (Yes/No).
acceptanceCriteria: The main view contains the question text "Will you be my Valentine, Tamanna?".
The page has no additional primary flows or navigation beyond this interaction.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page Valentine experience container and render the prompt state with the exact question text and exactly two visible buttons (Yes/No), with no additional navigation or flows.
Create a dedicated ValentineExperience component to encapsulate the prompt state and success state logic, keeping the app single-purpose and easy to reason about.
Ensure App renders the single-purpose Valentine experience as the only primary UI (no routing/navigation introduced).

requirements.summary: Make the "No" button evasive on hover/pointer and touch so it relocates within bounds and never triggers success.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop/laptop, when the pointer enters or hovers the "No" button, the button relocates within the visible card/container bounds.
On touch devices (iPad), when the user attempts to tap the "No" button (e.g., touchstart/pointerdown), the button relocates before a click can be registered.
The "No" button never triggers a success state or image reveal.

file_operations.description: Implement an EvasiveNoButton that repositions itself to a randomized safe location within a provided container on pointer enter/move and pointer down/touch start, and does not expose any success-triggering handler.
Wire EvasiveNoButton into the prompt view with a relatively-positioned container/card, pass refs/bounds needed for safe repositioning, and ensure the "No" action never transitions to success.

requirements.summary: On "Yes" click, transition in-place to a success view showing the message "Good choice" and a provided photo at iPad-friendly sizing.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Yes" transitions to a success view/state without reloading the page.
The success view shows the text "Good choice" exactly.
The success view displays one of the user-provided uploaded images (Tamanna.jpeg or Tamanna-1.jpeg) at a reasonable size for iPad screens.

file_operations.description: Add the user-provided photo asset Tamanna.jpeg to the frontend public assets so it can be displayed in the success view.
Add the user-provided photo asset Tamanna-1.jpeg to the frontend public assets so it can be displayed in the success view.

Implement the "Yes" click state transition (no page reload) to a success view that renders the exact text "Good choice" and displays one of the provided images with responsive, iPad-friendly sizing and aspect handling.

requirements.summary: Apply a simple, coherent romantic theme (pink/white palette, typography consistency, subtle heart/romantic accents and gentle animations).
acceptanceCriteria: Primary background and UI surfaces use a pink/white palette (no dominant unrelated color scheme).
The UI looks coherent (consistent button styles, fonts, spacing).
Animations (if any) are subtle and do not interfere with the Yes/No interaction.

file_operations.description: Define global base styles and a pink/white romantic theme using Tailwind layers (background treatment, typographic defaults, and subtle animation utilities) while keeping visuals simple and cohesive.
Apply consistent Tailwind styling for romantic UI surfaces (card/container), typography, spacing, and subtle accents (e.g., small hearts/gradients) without adding extra flows.

requirements.summary: Ensure iPad Chrome compatibility with responsive layout, large tap targets, and pointer/touch-based evasive interaction (not hover-only).
acceptanceCriteria: Layout adapts to common iPad viewport sizes without overflowing or requiring horizontal scroll.
Buttons meet comfortable tap target sizing (at least ~44px height) and are easy to interact with.
The evasive behavior functions via pointer/touch events on iPad (not only CSS :hover).

file_operations.description: Ensure responsive layout constraints (centered container, safe padding, no horizontal overflow) and minimum tap target sizing for both buttons; validate that the prompt/success views fit iPad viewports.

Harden iPad interaction handling by using pointer/touch events (e.g., pointerdown/touchstart) to relocate before click registration; avoid hover-only logic and ensure repositioning stays within visible bounds.
